text: Hi , is there any way to upload the custom font in HubSpot theme and use for the website ?
custom font which will not be on google
I’d love to be able to make the entire theme not available for pages etc (similar to how modules and templates work). This would help with building the theme in the portal

For themes, does the `module.css` have to be in the module or can it be stored in the global `main.css`? I am developing locally and have all my SCSS variables set and it makes it hard to path it to a certain module. Will HubSpot accept a theme that keeps it all in `main.css`?
<@UUX58C0S3> you can load fonts as an @font-face or link it as you normally would on any other standard HTML document

If you want to force a user of your theme to use a specific typeface I would recommend changing the theme fields.json file though so that you do not have the standard typography options there.

Although, I personally wouldnt recommend limiting the typeface choices if youre looking to put this theme on the marketplace.

It all needs to be contained inside of the module folder. You could always roll your own CSS files for each module and add them to main.css — then just disregard the module.css files. They wont be loaded if there isnt anything in them.

This could also help with CSS bloat - ie will help your page speed score because youre loading less files - but in reality might end up slowing the page speed down because if you make an update to one module the whole main.css sheet will need to be reloaded and cached again instead of just the single module.css file.
